selection_reasoning: We carry forward the top L-BFGS-B penalty method (trial_1_0) and the basin-hopping variant (trial_1_2) for performance, plus three diverse approaches—coordinate search (trial_1_3), unconstrained reparameterization (trial_1_7), and a fast constructive hex/force method (trial_1_6)—to balance exploitation and exploration. These cover gradient-based, global, derivative-free, reparameterized, and constructive paradigms.

trial_selections.reasoning: Top score (2.6127). Penalized L-BFGS-B with analytic gradients and LP cleanup appears robust; best baseline to refine.
Second-best (2.5771). Basin-hopping + analytic-gradient local search with LP finalization offers a different global exploration path.
Alternating coordinate search on centers with LP objective; derivative-free and structurally different, useful for escaping local minima patterns.
Unconstrained reparameterization (sigmoid + smooth-min) for radii; distinct parameterization that may converge differently, followed by LP cleanup.
Hex/tri-grid seeding with light force-directed polish and LP; fast constructive pipeline that can seed stronger optimizers or be tuned for better layouts.
